advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT (1985)</strong></font><br><blockquote>This detailed advert presents a complete EXL-100 with all the pripherals available then (printer, disk, tape, modem, carts, etc.). <br><br> "Exelvision, the french micro-computing challenge"</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> COMPARISON CHART</strong></font><br><blockquote>This document compares the different Panasonic systems of the serie<p class="petitgris">Thanks to Juraj Mucko for this picture</p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. AD. JUNE 1983</strong></font><br><blockquote>First advert of the Model 100.</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH AD (JAN. 1985)</strong></font><br><blockquote>"Maxi Basic Yeno SC 3000 : program at full gallop"</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH AD (DEC. 1986)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH AD #2 (1984)</strong></font><br><blockquote>"Electron, software in profusion"</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> US AD. 1983 #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>Hard disk version<br><br> "<font color="#666666">No matter how you look at it, KAYPRO is the best value you will see anawhere...</font>"</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT. PAGE #1</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> UK ADVERT (DEC. 1979)</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to David Wilson for this picture</p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> M-SERIES BROCHURE - PAGE 3</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to Juraj Mucko for this picture</p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> US ADVERT APR. 1982</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Courtesy of <b><a href="http://www.aci.com.pl/mwichary/" target="_blank">Attached</a></b></p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> GERMAN AD</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> QL CATALOGUE #8</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> TAPE RECORDER ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Courtesy of <b>8bs.com</b></p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> NLS ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>An advert from Non-Linear Systems, dated July, 1982 for the KAYCOMP II that was not still called KAYPRO. <br><br> Advert said:<br><br> <font color="#666666"><b>A WORD ABOUT NLS</b><br> Non-Linear Systems, inc. is the originator of the digital voltmeter and an innovative leader in the field of electronic test equipment.<br> Organized in 1952, NLS has been a major supplier of digital voltmeters and ratiometers to large corporations in the aerospace industry. Since 1972, NLS has been consumer directed, providing small, portable multimeters, oscilloscopes, counters, frequency meters, temperature meters. And now, NLS has entered the world of computers with one though - to provide the best value in a small, business, scientific and family computer.</font><br><br> Standard software delivered with the KAYCOMP II: <br><br> - <b>CP/M 2.2</b> - operating system<br> - <b>S/BASIC</b> - Structured Basic compiler<br> - <b>PROFIT PLAN</b> - Electronic worksheet<br> - <b>SELECT</b> - Complete word processing system<br> - <b>TEACH</b> - A self-teaching guide to SELECT </blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT (NOV.1990)</strong></font><br><blockquote>"don't touch my Amstrad gaming system !"</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> UK ADVERT, OCT 1983 </strong></font><br><blockquote>Probably the last advert made by T.I. in the UK</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> JAPANESE ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> IN THE KITCHEN...</strong></font><br><blockquote>A TO-7 in the kitchen? For sure it makes smile the woman!</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.K. AD. 1984</strong></font><br><blockquote>In the same magazine, Robert Hardling, the marketing manager of Atari Corporation said:<br><br><font color="#666666"> I envisage the situation where each house in 20 years time will have two, three or maybe more computers, ranging from a basic game machine through a home computer for education and home management and culminating in a fully fledged hyghly sophisticated computing work-station.<br> In the future, there may be only 3-4 major worldwide manufacturers. The IBM's, Apple's, Commodore's and Atari's of the world.</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> GERMAN ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.K. AD (AUG. 1986)</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

computer.description: Midos is an operating system designed for the fairchild 9445. Four others computers can be connected onto the Profi.
computer.name: PROFI 203
